body_html:
You can get similar functionality now with "scope.global_variables()": https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/ops/variable_scope.py#L907 (there is scope.trainable_variables as well) on the variable scope objects.

That said I'm not against this change, as it is backwards-compatible
body_text:
You can get similar functionality now with "scope.global_variables()": https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/ops/variable_scope.py#L907 (there is scope.trainable_variables as well) on the variable scope objects.
That said I'm not against this change, as it is backwards-compatible
body:
You can get similar functionality now with "scope.global_variables()": https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/ops/variable_scope.py#L907 (there is scope.trainable_variables as well) on the variable scope objects.

That said I'm not against this change, as it is backwards-compatible
